item.title: First Watch: People Get Ready, 'Middle Name'
item.description: The dancers and singers of People Get Ready put on a performance that makes "Middle Name" a video to remember.
item.content:encoded:
The dancers and singers of People Get Ready put on a performance that makes "Middle Name" a video to remember.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Jazz Salutes Its Disc Jockeys
item.description: The advent of bebop added a fresh sound to American music. It also added new voices to some metropolitan radio stations: the late-night jazz DJs who specialized in presenting this new music to their fellow hipster nightflies. Appreciative musicians often wrote them tributes like these.
item.content:encoded:
The advent of bebop added a fresh sound to American music. It also added new voices to some metropolitan radio stations: the late-night jazz DJs who specialized in presenting this new music to their fellow hipster nightflies. Appreciative musicians often wrote them tributes like these.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Bonnie Bishop On Mountain Stage
item.description: The Americana singer-songwriter was nominated for "Vocal Performance of the Year" at the Lone Star Music Awards and co-wrote a song with former NRBQ guitarist Al Anderson that was recorded by Bonnie Raitt. Here, she gives a solo performance with songs from her latest album, Free.
item.content:encoded:
The Americana singer-songwriter was nominated for "Vocal Performance of the Year" at the Lone Star Music Awards and co-wrote a song with former NRBQ guitarist Al Anderson that was recorded by Bonnie Raitt. Here, she gives a solo performance with songs from her latest album, Free.

item.title: Guest DJ With California Poet Laureate Juan Felipe Herrera
item.description: Alt.Latino celebrates National Poetry Month with Herrera, who discusses the songs that shaped him.
item.content:encoded:
Alt.Latino celebrates National Poetry Month with Herrera, who discusses the songs that shaped him.

item.title: What Nick Drake Taught Me About Art And Love
item.description: Some music feels so personal, it's hard to think about sharing it with anyone else. A new tribute album of songs by the folk singer Nick Drake (featuring many musicians who themselves hold Drake dear) tests the limits of one critic's ability to share that love.
item.content:encoded:
Some music feels so personal, it's hard to think about sharing it with anyone else. A new tribute album of songs by the folk singer Nick Drake (featuring many musicians who themselves hold Drake dear) tests the limits of one critic's ability to share that love.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: How Do You Handle Loneliness On The Road?
item.description: The refreshingly open American mezzo Joyce DiDonato doles out some great advice — and not just to aspiring singers. In her latest YouTube video, she tackles subjects ranging from alienation to friendships to creating a life free from expectations of what's "right."
item.content:encoded:
The refreshingly open American mezzo Joyce DiDonato doles out some great advice — and not just to aspiring singers. In her latest YouTube video, she tackles subjects ranging from alienation to friendships to creating a life free from expectations of what's "right."

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Listen: Yo-Yo Ma Plays Bach's 'Cello Suite No. 5 in C Minor'
item.description: Ma said he thought of the piece as "a struggle for hope," capturing the feeling in Boston perfectly.
item.content:encoded:
Ma said he thought of the piece as "a struggle for hope," capturing the feeling in Boston perfectly.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Lang Lang Shares A Tale Of Two Teachers
item.description: A great art teacher can make a huge difference in a young life — and a bad teacher can be a great discouragement. Concert pianist Lang Lang tells us about a bad teacher he had and a great teacher who led him to discovering the music of many different cultures.
item.content:encoded:
A great art teacher can make a huge difference in a young life — and a bad teacher can be a great discouragement. Concert pianist Lang Lang tells us about a bad teacher he had and a great teacher who led him to discovering the music of many different cultures.

item.title: Latin Roots: Fado Creates 'Nostalgia For The Present Moment'
item.description: Singer-songwriter and Grammy-nominated producer Rachel Faro explores a Portuguese tradition.
item.content:encoded:
Singer-songwriter and Grammy-nominated producer Rachel Faro explores a Portuguese tradition.

item.title: Shovels And Rope: A Husband And Wife, A Homemade Sound
item.description: The married roots-rock duo plays songs from O' Be Joyful, and discusses the making of the album.
item.content:encoded:
The married roots-rock duo plays songs from O' Be Joyful, and discusses the making of the album.

item.title: Terri Lyne Carrington On JazzSet
item.description: JazzSet is in Boston for Money Jungle: Provocative in Blue, a release concert for the album created by Carrington, professor of percussion at Berklee College of Music. It's a trio album with ensemble touches, and in this concert from Berklee Performance Center, Carrington's students are in the mix.
item.content:encoded:
JazzSet is in Boston for Money Jungle: Provocative in Blue, a release concert for the album created by Carrington, professor of percussion at Berklee College of Music. It's a trio album with ensemble touches, and in this concert from Berklee Performance Center, Carrington's students are in the mix.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: We Get Mail: Do CD Hoarders Need An Intervention?
item.description: For those with stacks of CDs and little desire to go digital, how do you thin out your collection?
item.content:encoded:
For those with stacks of CDs and little desire to go digital, how do you thin out your collection?

item.title: Korean-American Rapper Changing The Face Of Hip-Hop
item.description: Korean-American rapper Dumbfoundead used to get the mic pulled out of his hands at rap battles. But the Los Angeles artist has steadily won fans and made a name for himself in the world of hip-hop. Host Michel Martin talks with NPR'S Karen Grigsby Bates about what his success says about the evolution of rap.
item.content:encoded:
Korean-American rapper Dumbfoundead used to get the mic pulled out of his hands at rap battles. But the Los Angeles artist has steadily won fans and made a name for himself in the world of hip-hop. Host Michel Martin talks with NPR'S Karen Grigsby Bates about what his success says about the evolution of rap.

» E-Mail This     » Add to Del.icio.us

item.title: Coachella's Hometown Aims To Cash In On Fest's Rising Tide
item.description: The highest-grossing music festival in the world happens in a city struggling to stay afloat.
item.content:encoded:
The highest-grossing music festival in the world happens in a city struggling to stay afloat.

item.title: The Diverse Influence Of The 2013 Rock Hall Inductees
item.description: As the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inducts a new class, musicians and writers look at how influence — one of the Hall's criteria for induction — plays out in ways obvious (how Beyonce draws on Donna Summer) and not so much (jazz pianist Vijay Iyer explains how Public Enemy shaped his music).
item.content:encoded:
As the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inducts a new class, musicians and writers look at how influence — one of the Hall's criteria for induction — plays out in ways obvious (how Beyonce draws on Donna Summer) and not so much (jazz pianist Vijay Iyer explains how Public Enemy shaped his music).
